author: Jaykul
body:
Summary of the new feature/enhancement
# PSCredential should support casting from NetworkCredential

```
As a PowerShell user
I should be able to automatically convert PSCredential parameter objects to NetworkCredential objects for APIs

As a C# cmdlet author
I should be able to cast NetworkCredential objects to PowerShell APIs that take PSCredential
```

We should never force workarounds like what I just saw in a code review:

```posh
    $InstanceInfo = Get-ConnectionInfo -Type Authoring
    # PowerShell isn't .NET compatible, so we have to make their special cred type
    $PSCredential = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential($InstanceInfo.Credential.UserName, $InstanceInfo.Credential.SecurePassword)
```

Since NetworkCredential is the de-facto credential class in .NET, having a special class in PowerShell is frustrating. Not being able to cast back and forth when the conversion is obvious seems designed to frustrate users. Although there was a reason once, it's purely legacy and security theatre at this point. Remember:

1. PowerShell ships a format to hide the NetworkCredential Password property
2. The NetworkCredential class now uses a SecureString for storage
3. In .NET Core the SecureString class doesn't really feel that secure anyway
4. PSCredential's only remaining advantage is it's first-class nature in PowerShell (and the implied Credential attribute for parameters)


### Is there any other reason we should not be able to cast _back and forth_ from NetworkCredential to PSCredential? 

# Proposed technical implementation details:

- For C#:
  - PSCredential to implement implicit cast operators for NetworkCredential
- For PowerShell
  - PSCredential to add a constructor that takes a NetworkCredential
  - Identical handling for NetworkCredential parameters as for PSCredential parameters
  - PSTypeConverters for NetworkCredential and PSCredential so both can be converted to each other, and can serialize _safely_

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
I'll have to defer to security folks on this one, but from a usability standpoint this makes sense to me. 

A mapping of properties and constructors between types would probably be the next step. Giving a cursory look at the docs ([NetworkCredential](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.net.networkcredential.domain?view=netcore-3.0) and [PSCredential](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.management.automation.pscredential?view=pscore-6.2.0), we have to figure out things like whether to never populate `Password` (vs. `SecurePassword`), what to do with `Domain`, etc.

Also wondering aloud if there are any implications with our secrets management work (/cc @SydneyhSmith @PaulHigin)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: If we support casting from `NetworkCredential`, it should have no impact on the Secrets Management module unless there is a need to support that type natively.  `Domain` is pretty straight forward to figure out and there might be some apis that do that already.  `Password` gets auto-populated by the NetworkCredential constructor even if you pass in a SecureString.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: At first look, I don't see any security issues with converting between NetworkCredential and PSCredential types.  And I agree that this shouldn't affect SecretsManagement module work.

title: Can we add a cast constructor to PSCredential for NetworkCredential?
